page.title: 09LANDSCAPE:SAND QUARRYING
page.content: The{soil in Potton is sandy.}It has been suggested that most of the sand is from the Ice Age and has accumulated over the years. In our 'block' there are{three sand quarries {the Eastern, Redland and Tarmac {companies.}Eastern's is the oldest quarry in Potton. This quarry covers about thirty acres and is about twenty six metres deep. From it twelve thousand tons of sand are dug each day. Over two hundred thousand tons of sand are extracted from the quarry each year. Most of the sand goes to London and is used for bricklaying and asphalt roofing.
